title: Celebrity X Factor's Martin Bashir sets his sights on interviewing Simon Cowell
text:

Martin Bashir says he only has two people he still wants to interview – the pope and “the pope of music” Simon Cowell .

The broadcaster, 56, is best known for his high-profile TV interviews with Diana, Princess of Wales and Michael Jackson.

But last weekend on X Factor : Celebrity he wowed viewers with a different kind of performance as he belted out Nat King Cole’s L-O-V-E in his first audition for judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger during tonight’s opening show.

On Cowell he said: “Who wouldn’t want to interview Simon Cowell? And I’d also be keen to be given an extended opportunity to interview with Pope Francis. So the cardinal of music and Pope Francis would be my two bucket list interviewees.

“While he’s often in the press and he gives quotes Simon’s never actually talked in detail about what motivates him. Whether this persona on set is him or is it just an act?

“I’m also interested in whether he feels that he’s been a force for good with these programmes because although people have gone on to great careers, I imagine that a lot of people have found that it’s the end of the road for them. I wonder what he feels about that. So yeah, he’d be fascinating.”

TV Insiders say if Martin is a hit on the show ITV could be interested in a special with Martin and Cowell.

Told about Martin’s wish, Cowell said: “I think if we get on well on the show, maybe, yeah. Every time I do these interviews they always try and make you cry now.

"That’s the problem. I learned that with Piers Morgan.”

Cowell appeared on the third series of Piers Morgan’s Life Stories in March 2010.

The X Factor: Celebrity returns to ITV tomorrow night and this weekend Bashir will find out if he is through to the live shows.
description: The broadcaster, 56, is best known for his high-profile TV interviews with Diana, Princess of Wales and Michael Jackson so it's no wonder he wants to speak to Simon next
